examples: lately the rules have been enforced
as late as yesterday she was fine

results.definition: at or toward an end or late period or stage of development
examples: a later symptom of the disease
later medical science could have saved the child

results.definition: later than usual or than expected
examples: the children came late to school
I belatedly wished her a happy birthday

results.definition: after the expected or usual time; delayed
(used especially of persons) of the immediate past
examples: our late President is still very active

results.definition: of the immediate past or just previous to the present time
being or occurring at an advanced period of time or after a usual or expected time
of a later stage in the development of a language or literature; used especially of dead languages
